<Link id="l00220" /><CodeLine lineNumber="220"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Return the minimum hotness value a diagnostic would need in order</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00221" /><CodeLine lineNumber="221"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// to be included in optimization diagnostics.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00222" /><CodeLine lineNumber="222"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00223" /><CodeLine lineNumber="223"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Three possible return values:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00224" /><CodeLine lineNumber="224"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// 0            - threshold is disabled. Everything will be printed out.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00225" /><CodeLine lineNumber="225"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// positive int - threshold is set.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00226" /><CodeLine lineNumber="226"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// UINT64&#95;MAX   - threshold is not yet set, and needs to be synced from</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00227" /><CodeLine lineNumber="227"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                profile summary. Note that in case of missing profile</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00228" /><CodeLine lineNumber="228"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                summary, threshold will be kept at &quot;MAX&quot;, effectively</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00229" /><CodeLine lineNumber="229"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                suppresses all remarks output.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00230" /><CodeLine lineNumber="230"><Highlight kind="normal">  uint64&#95;t <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/llvmcontext/#aded771687bdc915d3b992cbbee8c22c7">getDiagnosticsHotnessThreshold</a>() </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00265" /><CodeLine lineNumber="265"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Report a message to the currently installed diagnostic handler.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00266" /><CodeLine lineNumber="266"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00267" /><CodeLine lineNumber="267"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// This function returns, in particular in the case of error reporting</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00268" /><CodeLine lineNumber="268"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// (DI.Severity == \\a DS&#95;Error), so the caller should leave the compilation</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00269" /><CodeLine lineNumber="269"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// process in a self-consistent state, even though the generated code</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00270" /><CodeLine lineNumber="270"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// need not be correct.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00271" /><CodeLine lineNumber="271"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00272" /><CodeLine lineNumber="272"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The diagnostic message will be implicitly prefixed with a severity keyword</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00273" /><CodeLine lineNumber="273"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// according to \\p DI.getSeverity(), i.e., &quot;error: &quot; for \\a DS&#95;Error,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00274" /><CodeLine lineNumber="274"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// &quot;warning: &quot; for \\a DS&#95;Warning, and &quot;note: &quot; for \\a DS&#95;Note.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00275" /><CodeLine lineNumber="275"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/llvmcontext/#aad03ef5cfbe6e7cad076d9e45ba06592">diagnose</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/diagnosticinfo">DiagnosticInfo</a> &amp;DI);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00276" /><CodeLine lineNumber="276"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00277" /><CodeLine lineNumber="277"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Registers a yield callback with the given context.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00278" /><CodeLine lineNumber="278"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00279" /><CodeLine lineNumber="279"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The yield callback function may be called by LLVM to transfer control back</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00280" /><CodeLine lineNumber="280"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// to the client that invoked the LLVM compilation. This can be used to yield</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00281" /><CodeLine lineNumber="281"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// control of the thread, or perform periodic work needed by the client.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00282" /><CodeLine lineNumber="282"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// There is no guaranteed frequency at which callbacks must occur; in fact,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00283" /><CodeLine lineNumber="283"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// the client is not guaranteed to ever receive this callback. It is at the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00284" /><CodeLine lineNumber="284"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// sole discretion of LLVM to do so and only if it can guarantee that</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00285" /><CodeLine lineNumber="285"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// suspending the thread won&#39;t block any forward progress in other LLVM</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00286" /><CodeLine lineNumber="286"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// contexts in the same process.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00287" /><CodeLine lineNumber="287"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00288" /><CodeLine lineNumber="288"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// At a suspend point, the state of the current LLVM context is intentionally</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00289" /><CodeLine lineNumber="289"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// undefined. No assumptions about it can or should be made. Only LLVM</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00290" /><CodeLine lineNumber="290"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// context API calls that explicitly state that they can be used during a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00291" /><CodeLine lineNumber="291"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// yield callback are allowed to be used. Any other API calls into the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00292" /><CodeLine lineNumber="292"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// context are not supported until the yield callback function returns</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00293" /><CodeLine lineNumber="293"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// control to LLVM. Other LLVM contexts are unaffected by this restriction.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00294" /><CodeLine lineNumber="294"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/llvmcontext/#a26b9a4decea0c52a7225bc63c8166f90">setYieldCallback</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/llvmcontext/#a8671da9544d8cfdf4ccc798e560bdccc">YieldCallbackTy</a> Callback, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;OpaqueHandle);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00295" /><CodeLine lineNumber="295"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00296" /><CodeLine lineNumber="296"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Calls the yield callback (if applicable).</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00297" /><CodeLine lineNumber="297"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00298" /><CodeLine lineNumber="298"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// This transfers control of the current thread back to the client, which may</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00299" /><CodeLine lineNumber="299"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// suspend the current thread. Only call this method when LLVM doesn&#39;t hold</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00300" /><CodeLine lineNumber="300"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// any global mutex or cannot block the execution in another LLVM context.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00301" /><CodeLine lineNumber="301"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/llvmcontext/#a547073a4bb4e2577f0bcee9a2173d349">yield</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00302" /><CodeLine lineNumber="302"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00303" /><CodeLine lineNumber="303"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// emitError - Emit an error message to the currently installed error handler</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00304" /><CodeLine lineNumber="304"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// with optional location information.  This function returns, so code should</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00305" /><CodeLine lineNumber="305"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// be prepared to drop the erroneous construct on the floor and &quot;not crash&quot;.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00306" /><CodeLine lineNumber="306"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The generated code need not be correct.  The error message will be</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00308" /><CodeLine lineNumber="308"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/llvmcontext/#a4447dfc5ac5a8784a0a933a5be56bbf5">emitError</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine">Twine</a> &amp;ErrorStr);</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00322" /><CodeLine lineNumber="322"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Get or set the current &quot;default&quot; target CPU (target-cpu function</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00323" /><CodeLine lineNumber="323"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// attribute). The intent is that compiler frontends will set this to a value</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00324" /><CodeLine lineNumber="324"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// that reflects the attribute that a function would get &quot;by default&quot; without</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00325" /><CodeLine lineNumber="325"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// any specific function attributes, and compiler passes will attach the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00326" /><CodeLine lineNumber="326"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// attribute to newly created functions that are not associated with a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00327" /><CodeLine lineNumber="327"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// particular function, such as global initializers.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00328" /><CodeLine lineNumber="328"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Function::createWithDefaultAttr() will create functions with this</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00329" /><CodeLine lineNumber="329"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// attribute. This function should only be called by passes that run at</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00330" /><CodeLine lineNumber="330"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// compile time and not by the backend or LTO passes.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
